dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 353 IH: Family First Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Moore of Utah introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to enhance the child tax credit, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Family First Act.

title.header: Child Tax Credit and Tax Credit for Pregnant Mothers

section.header: Permanent expansion of child tax credit

subsection.text: Section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsections (a) through (e) and inserting the following new subsections:
There shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of the base credit amount.
For purposes of paragraph (1), the base credit amount shall be an amount equal to the sum of—

subparagraph.text: for each qualifying child who has not attained age 6 as of the close of the calendar year in which the taxable year of the taxpayer begins, $4,200, and
for each qualifying child of the taxpayer who is not described in subparagraph (A), $3,000.

subsection.header: Applicable percentage and limitation based on adjusted gross income

paragraph.text: For purposes of subsection (a), the applicable percentage shall be—

subparagraph.text: in the case of a taxpayer whose modified adjusted gross income is equal to or greater than $20,000, 100 percent, or
in the case of a taxpayer whose modified adjusted gross income is less than $20,000, an amount (expressed as a percentage) equal to the quotient of—

clause.text: the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer, divided by

paragraph.text: The amount of the credit allowable under subsection (a) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by $50 for each $1,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds—

subparagraph.text: in the case of a joint return, $400,000, or
in any other case, $200,000.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term modified adjusted gross income means adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933.

subparagraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after 2026, each of the $20,000 amounts in paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: $20,000, multiplied by
the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting 2025 for 2016 in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

subparagraph.text: If any increase under this paragraph is not a multiple of $100, such increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $100.

subsection.text: For purposes of this section—

paragraph.text: The term qualifying child means a qualifying child of the taxpayer (as defined in section 152(c)) who has not attained age 18 as of the close of the calendar year in which the taxable year of the taxpayer begins.

The term qualifying child shall not include any individual who would not be a dependent if subparagraph (A) of section 152(b)(3) were applied without regard to all that follows resident of the United States.

subsection.text: The number of qualifying children of a taxpayer for which a credit may be allowed under this section for any taxable year shall not exceed 6.

paragraph.text: No credit shall be allowed under this section to a taxpayer who does not include on the return of tax for the taxable year—

subparagraph.text: the social security number of the taxpayer (and, in the case of a joint return, the social security number of at least 1 spouse), and
with respect to any qualifying child, the name and the social security number of such qualifying child.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term social security number means, with respect to a return of tax, a social security number issued to an individual by the Social Security Administration, but only if the social security number is issued—

subparagraph.text: to a citizen of the United States or pursuant to subclause (I) (or that portion of subclause (III) that relates to subclause (I)) of section 205(c)(2)(B)(i) of the Social Security Act, and
before the due date of filing such return.

paragraph.text: by striking subsections (h) through (j),
in subsection (k)—

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (2) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: In the case of any bona fide resident of Puerto Rico (within the meaning of section 937(a)), the credit determined under this section shall be allowable to such resident.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and without regard to the application of this section to bona fide residents of Puerto Rico under subsection (i)(1), and
in subparagraph (C), by striking clause (ii) and inserting the following:

clause.header: Application of section in event of absence of approved plan
clause.text: In the case of a taxable year with respect to which a plan is not approved under subparagraph (B), rules similar to the rules of paragraph (2) shall apply with respect to bona fide residents of American Samoa (within the meaning of section 937(a)).

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (k) (as amended by paragraph (3)) as subsection (h).

paragraph.header: Credit moved to subpart relating to refundable credits

subparagraph.text: The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

clause.text: by redesignating section 24, as amended by this section, as section 36C, and
by moving such section, as so redesignated, from subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 to the location immediately after section 36B in subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1.

subparagraph.text: Subsection (a) of section 36C of such Code, as moved and redesignated by subparagraph (A), is amended by striking this chapter and inserting this subtitle.

clause.text: The table of sections for subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by striking the item relating to section 24.
The table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

subparagraph.text: Section 26(b)(2) of such Code is amended—

clause.text: by striking , and at the end of subparagraph (Y) and inserting a period,
by inserting and at the end of subparagraph (X), and
by striking subparagraph (Z).

subparagraph.text: Section 45R(f)(3)(B) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

Any amounts paid pursuant to an agreement under section 3121(l) (relating to agreements entered into by American employers with respect to foreign affiliates) which are equivalent to the taxes referred to in subparagraph (A) shall be treated as taxes referred to in such subparagraph.
Section 48D(d)(4) of such Code is amended by striking section 24(k) and inserting section 36C(h).
Section 152(f)(6)(B)(ii) of such Code is amended by striking section 24 and inserting section 36C.
Section 501(c)(26) of such Code is amended in the flush matter at the end by striking section 24(c)) and inserting section 36C(c)).
Section 3402(f)(1)(C) of such Code is amended by striking section 24 (determined after application of subsection (j) thereof) and inserting section 36C.
Section 6103(l)(13)(A)(v) of such Code is amended by striking section 24 and inserting section 36C.
Section 6211(b)(4)(A) of such Code is amended—

clause.text: by striking 24 by reason of subsections (d) and (i)(1) thereof,,
by inserting and 36C after 36B,, and
by striking , 6428, 6428A, 6428B, and 7527A.

subparagraph.text: Section 6213(g)(2) of such Code is amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (I), by striking correct TIN required under section 24(e) and inserting correct social security number required under section 36C(e),
in subparagraph (L)—

subclause.text: by striking 24, or 32 and inserting 32, or 36C, and
by striking TIN each place it appears and inserting TIN or social security number, and

clause.text: in subparagraph (P)—

subclause.text: by striking 24(g)(2) and inserting 36C(g)(2), and
by striking section 24 and inserting section 36C.

subparagraph.text: Section 6402(m) of such Code is amended by striking section 24 (by reason of subsection (d) thereof) or 32 and inserting section 32 or 36C.
Section 6417(f) of such Code is amended by striking section 24(k) and inserting section 36C(h).
Section 6695(g)(2) of such Code is amended by striking 24, 25A(a)(1), or 32 and inserting 25A(a)(1), 32, or 36C.
Section 1324(b)(2) of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

clause.text: by striking 24,, and
by inserting 36C, after 36B,.

subparagraph.text: Section 1613(a)(11)(A) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1382b(a)(11)(A)) is amended by striking section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to child tax credit) by reason of subsection (d) thereof and inserting section 36C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to child tax credit).
Chapter 77 of such Code is amended by striking section 7527A (and the item relating to such section in the table of sections for such chapter).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
Subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 36C (as redesignated by section 101) the following new section:

In the case of an eligible taxpayer with a qualifying unborn child, there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the applicable percentage of $2,800.

paragraph.text: For purposes of subsection (a), the applicable percentage shall be—

subparagraph.text: in the case of a taxpayer whose modified adjusted gross income is equal to or greater than $10,000, 100 percent, or
in the case of a taxpayer whose modified adjusted gross income is less than $10,000, the amount (expressed as a percentage) equal to the quotient of—

clause.text: the modified adjusted gross income of the taxpayer, divided by

paragraph.text: The amount of the credit allowable under subsection (a) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by $50 for each $1,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds—

subparagraph.text: in the case of a joint return, $400,000, or
in any other case, $200,000.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the term modified adjusted gross income has the same meaning given such term in section 36C(b)(3).

subparagraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after 2026, each of the $10,000 amounts in paragraph (1) shall be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: $10,000, multiplied by
the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting 2025 for 2016 in subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof.

subparagraph.text: If any increase under this paragraph is not a multiple of $100, such increase shall be rounded to the next lowest multiple of $100.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this section, the term qualifying unborn child means an unborn child whose gestational age is 20 weeks or greater, as certified by a physician in accordance with paragraph (2).

subparagraph.text: Upon the request of the mother, a physician may make a determination with respect to the gestational age of the unborn child. Any determination made under this paragraph shall be based on the reasonable medical judgment of the physician following such inquiries, examinations, and tests as a reasonably prudent physician would deem necessary for purposes of making such determination.

If the physician has made a determination pursuant to subparagraph (A) that the gestational age of the unborn child is 20 weeks or greater, such physician may, upon the request of the mother, provide the mother with a form which includes the following:

clause.text: The gestational age and the expected due date of the unborn child.
The name and social security number of the mother.
If applicable, the name and social security number of the spouse of such mother.
The name and contact information of the physician.
A written certification from such physician stating, under penalty of perjury pursuant to section 1746 of title 28, that—

subclause.text: the mother was determined to have been pregnant with the unborn child, according to standard medical practice, by such physician, and
such physician has determined that, in their reasonable medical judgment, the gestational age of the unborn child is 20 weeks or greater.

clause.text: A written certification from the mother of the unborn child stating, under penalty of perjury pursuant to section 1746 of title 28, United States Code, that she—

subclause.text: is the biological mother of such unborn child, or
initiated the pregnancy with the intention of bearing and retaining custody of and parental rights to such child (or acted to such effect).

subparagraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the certification described in this paragraph shall not be used for any purpose other than to determine the eligibility of the taxpayer for the credit allowed under this section.

paragraph.text: In the case of the involuntary death of an unborn child, or the death of an unborn child as a result of any treatment intended to save the life of the mother or any treatment of an ectopic pregnancy, occurring after 20 weeks gestation, the death of such child shall have no effect with respect to whether the credit is allowed under this section to an eligible taxpayer, provided that such taxpayer otherwise satisfies the applicable requirements under this section.

paragraph.header: More than 1 unborn child during the same taxable year
paragraph.text: In the case of an eligible taxpayer who—

subparagraph.text: has more than 1 pregnancy during a taxable year, or
is determined to be pregnant with more than 1 qualifying unborn child,

paragraph.continuation-text: the credit under this section shall be allowed with respect to each qualifying unborn child.

paragraph.text: The allowance of a credit under this section with respect to a qualifying unborn child shall have no effect in regards to the application of section 36C with respect to such child after the date of their birth.

subsection.text: No credit shall be allowed under this section if an unborn child died as a result of an induced abortion, but not including any treatment intended to save the life of the mother or any treatment of an ectopic pregnancy.
In this section—

paragraph.text: The term eligible taxpayer means a taxpayer who—

subparagraph.text: with respect to an unborn child, is the mother who—

clause.text: carries or carried such child in the womb, and
is the biological mother of such child or initiated the pregnancy with the intention of bearing and retaining custody of and parental rights to such child (or acted to such effect), or

subparagraph.text: in the case of a joint return, is the spouse of such mother,

paragraph.continuation-text: but only if such taxpayer includes on the return of tax for the taxable year the social security number of such taxpayer (of at least 1 of such mother or spouse, in the case of a joint return).

paragraph.text: The term gestational age means the age of the unborn child, as calculated from the first day of the mother’s last menstrual period.
The term physician means an individual who is—

subparagraph.text: licensed to practice—

clause.text: medicine and surgery,
osteopathic medicine and surgery, or
midwifery, or

subparagraph.text: otherwise legally authorized to—

clause.text: perform births and to diagnose and attend miscarriages or stillbirths, and
perform examinations to determine the gestational age of an unborn child,

paragraph.continuation-text: by the State in which such practice is performed.

paragraph.text: The term reasonable medical judgment means a medical judgment that would be made by a reasonably prudent physician who is knowledgeable about the case and the treatment possibilities with respect to the medical conditions involved.
The term social security number has the meaning given such term by section 36C(e)(2).

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 36C the following new item:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

title.header: Other amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

section.header: Simplification of earned income credit for taxpayers with children

subsection.text: Section 32(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The amount of the credit allowable to a taxpayer under paragraph (1) for any taxable year shall not exceed the lesser of—

subparagraph.text: the excess (if any) of—

clause.text: the credit percentage of the earned income amount, over
the phaseout percentage of so much of the adjusted gross income (or, if greater, the earned income) of the taxpayer for the taxable year as exceeds the phaseout amount, or

subparagraph.text: an amount equal to—

clause.text: in the case of any taxpayer with no qualifying children—

subclause.text: who is not filing a joint return, $700, or
who is filing a joint return, $1,400, or

clause.text: in the case of any taxpayer with 1 or more qualifying children—

subclause.text: who is not filing a joint return, $4,300, or
who is filing a joint return, $5,000.

subsection.text: The table contained in section 32(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 1 qualifying child in the first row and inserting 1 or more qualifying children,
by striking 15.98 in the first row and inserting 25,
by striking the second and third rows, and
by striking 7.65 in the third column of the last row and inserting 10.

subsection.text: The table contained in section 32(b)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 1 qualifying child in the first row and inserting 1 or more qualifying children,
by striking $6,330 in the first row and inserting $12,647,
by striking $11,610 in the first row and inserting $33,000,
by striking the second row,
by striking $4,220 in the last row and inserting $9,150, and
by striking $5,280 in the last row and inserting $10,000.

subsection.text: Section 32(b)(2)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $5,000 and inserting “$10,000, and the earned income amount determined under subparagraph (A) shall be increased—

clause.text: by $2,059, in the case of a taxpayer with 1 or more qualifying children, and
by $9,151, in the case of a taxpayer with no qualifying children.

subsection.text: Section 32(j)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 2015 and inserting 2026,
by striking clauses (i) and (ii) of subparagraph (B) thereof and redesignating clause (iii) of such subparagraph as clause (ii), and
by inserting before clause (ii) of subparagraph (B) thereof, as so redesignated, the following new clause:

clause.text: in the case of amounts in subsection (b)(2), calendar year 2025 for calendar year 2016, and

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (2), the amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

subparagraph.text: Subject to subparagraph (B), in the case of any eligible individual (as defined in section 32(c)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) who has any qualifying children for the taxable year who are exempted children, section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall be applied with respect to such eligible individual as if the amendments made by subsections (a) through (e) of this section had not been enacted.
In the case of any eligible individual (as so defined) who has—

clause.text: any qualifying children for the taxable year who are not exempted children, and
any qualifying children for such taxable year who are exempted children,

subparagraph.continuation-text: section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall be applied separately with respect to the children described in clause (i) and (pursuant to the rules described in subparagraph (A)) the children described in clause (ii).

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term exempted child means an individual who is described in subparagraph (A)(ii) or (B) of section 152(c)(3).

section.header: Elimination of additional exemption for dependents

subsection.text: Section 151(d)(5) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.header: Elimination of additional exemption for dependents for taxable years after 2025
paragraph.text: In the case of a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2025—

subparagraph.text: For purposes of subsection (c), the term exemption amount means zero.

For purposes of any other provision of this title, the reduction of the exemption amount to zero under subparagraph (A) shall not be taken into account in determining whether a deduction is allowed or allowable, or whether a taxpayer is entitled to a deduction, under this section.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

section.header: Elimination of head of household filing status

subsection.text: Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (b),
in subsection (c)—

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking and heads of households, and
by striking or the head of a household as defined in section 2(b),

paragraph.text: in subsection (f), by striking (b), each place it appears,
in subsection (i)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(i), by striking (b),,
in subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text: in clause (i), by adding and at the end,
by striking clause (ii), and
by redesignating clause (iii) as clause (ii), and

clause.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking subparagraph (B)(iii) and inserting subparagraph (B)(ii),

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking (b),, and
in paragraph (3)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking (b),,
in subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text: by striking clause (ii), and
by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (ii) and (iii), respectively, and

clause.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking clauses (i), (ii), and (iii) and inserting clauses (i) and (ii), and

paragraph.text: in subsection (j)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: by striking subparagraph (B), and
in subparagraph (C), by striking and heads of households in the heading,

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3)(B)(ii), by striking or head of household, and
in paragraph (5)(B)—

clause.text: in clause (i)—

subclause.text: by striking subclause (II), and
by redesignating subclauses (III) and (IV) as subclauses (II) and (III), respectively, and

clause.text: in clause (ii)—

subclause.text: by striking subclause (II), and
by redesignating subclauses (III) and (IV) as subclauses (II) and (III), respectively.

paragraph.text: Section 25B(b)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

In the case of any taxpayer not described in paragraph (1), the applicable percentage shall be determined under paragraph (1) except that such paragraph shall be applied by substituting for each dollar amount therein (as adjusted under paragraph (3)) a dollar amount equal to 50 percent of such dollar amount.
Section 25E(b)(2) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by adding and at the end, and
by striking subparagraphs (B) and (C) and inserting the following:
in the case of a taxpayer not described in subparagraph (A), $75,000.

paragraph.text: Section 30D(f)(10)(B) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (i), by adding and at the end, and
by striking clauses (ii) and (iii) and inserting the following:

clause.text: in the case of a taxpayer not described in clause (i), $150,000.

paragraph.text: Section 36B(b)(3)(B)(ii)(I)(aa) of such Code is amended by striking and heads of households.
Section 63(c) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by adding or at the end,
by striking subparagraph (B), and
by redesignating subparagraph (C) as subparagraph (B),

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), by striking , (2)(C), each place it appears, and
in paragraph (7)—

clause.text: by striking subparagraph (A) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (2)(B) shall be applied by substituting $12,000 for $3,000.

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text: in clause (i), by striking paragraphs (2)(B) and (2)(C) and inserting paragraph (2)(B), and
in clause (ii), by striking $18,000 and $12,000 amounts and inserting $12,000 amount.

paragraph.text: Section 68(b) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: by striking subparagraph (B),
in subparagraph (C), by striking or head of household, and
by redesignating subparagraphs (C) and (D) as subparagraphs (B) and (C), respectively, and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C) and inserting subparagraphs (A) and (B).

paragraph.text: Section 904(b)(3)(E)(i)(I) of such Code is amended by striking (b),.
Section 6012(a)(1) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)—

clause.text: in clause (i), by striking is not a head of a household (as defined in section 2(b)),,
by striking clause (ii),
by redesignating clauses (iii) and (iv) as clauses (ii) and (iii), respectively, and
in the flush text at the end, by striking Clause (iv) and inserting Clause (iii), and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B)—

clause.text: by striking clause (i), (ii), or (iii) and inserting clause (i) or (ii), and
by striking clause (iv) and inserting clause (iii).

paragraph.text: Section 6433(b)(3)(B) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: In the case of any taxpayer who is not filing a joint return and who is not a surviving spouse (as defined in section 2(a)), the applicable dollar amount and the phaseout range shall be ½ of the amounts applicable under subparagraph (A) (as so adjusted).

paragraph.text: Section 6695(g) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Failure To be diligent in determining eligibility for certain tax benefits
subsection.text: Any person who is a tax return preparer with respect to any return or claim for refund who fails to comply with due diligence requirements imposed by the Secretary by regulations with respect to determining eligibility for, or the amount of, the credit allowable by section 25A(a)(1), 32, or 36C shall pay a penalty of $500 for each such failure.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

section.header: Exclusion of children from credit for expenses for household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment

subsection.text: Section 21 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: by striking subparagraph (A),
in subparagraph (B), by inserting who has attained age 18 and before who is physically or mentally incapable, and
by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:

Employment-related expenses described in subparagraph (A) which are incurred for services outside the taxpayer's household shall be taken into account only if incurred for the care of a qualifying individual who regularly spends at least 8 hours each day in the taxpayer's household.

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(2), by striking subsection (b)(1)(C) and inserting subsection (b)(1)(B), and
in subsection (e)(5)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking is under the age of 13 or and inserting has attained age 18 and, and
in the flush text at the end, by striking subparagraph (A) or (B) of subsection (b)(1) (whichever is appropriate) and inserting subsection (b)(1)(A).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

section.header: Limitation on deduction for State and local taxes of individuals

subsection.text: Section 164(b)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking beginning after December 31, 2017, and before January 1, 2026 and inserting beginning after December 31, 2025.
The heading for section 164(b)(6) of such Code is amended by striking 2018 through 2025 and inserting after 2025.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
